title.english: Yotoden: Chronicle of the Warlord Period

description:
In the year 1580, a man named Lord Nobunaga Oda sends hoards of unholy armies across Japan, slaying all who stand in their way. A young ninja escapes her villages' destruction with a short sword, one of the three mystical weapons that can end Oda's rule. During her quest, she is joined by two other ninjas who wield the other two weapons of legend, the sacred sword and spear.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

title.native: 戦国奇譚 妖刀伝 劇場版

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1476565711)

Originally an animator. Switched his focus to directing in the late '80s.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/本田保則) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasunori_Honda)

Founder and representative director of Arts Pro.

Junichi Watanabe was an animator, director, scriptwriter and photographic director. He collapsed and died of cerebral apoplexy during a phone call at work on January 22nd, 2007. Note: Pictured in 1988 (26 years old). (Source: AniDB)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).

Katsumi Itou is a sound effects creator. He is also the founder and the representative director of Swara Production and Three S Studio. Prior to creating Swara Pro, he worked at Ishida Sound Production (now Fizz Sound Creation).

(Source: AniDB)

Shuuichi Kakesu was born 1957 in Chiba Prefecture, Japan. He is a graduate student of Japan Academy of Moving Images and the founder and current representative director of editing studio Jay Film.

He started working at editing studio Okayasu Promotion, where he studied under Okayasu Hajime himself. In 1990 he founded Jay Film; or reorganised Kakesu Henshuushitsu, an editing studio he founded previously, into Jay Film. He was the first to introduce the non-linear editing system in Japan in 1994.

Kakesu won an Association of Media in Digital Award in 1996.

The founder and representative director of [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

In 1976, Miyata joined [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), and was assigned to the planning and literature department. Three years later he moved to being a producer.  After having left Tatsunoko he joined [Kitty Film](https://anilist.co/studio/99/) for some time before founding J.C. Staff in 1986.

After producing numerous works for J.C. Staff in the late '80s and throughout the '90s - he shifted his focus to a more managerial position in 2000, a position which he still holds to this day while serving as the studio's representative director.
